revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.

hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
hidden_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
hidden_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I've noticed a few things. There's this spot that sometimes bleeds without me even touching it. Also, there are these little dots popping up nearby, like it's spreading. It's bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it's still growing. Plus, the skin around it looks red and puffy, like it's irritated.

Thank you for providing those details. To better understand the cause of the lesion, can you tell me if you've experienced any pain or tenderness in that area? Also, have you noticed any fever or chills?
No, I haven’t felt any pain or tenderness, and I haven’t had any fever or chills either.
Thanks for the information. Can you tell me how long you've had this lesion? Also, has the surface of the lesion changed at all, like if it's developed any sores or a crust?
I’ve had it for a while, but I feel like it’s changing. And, yes, it's like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
Thank you. Have you had any similar spots like this before? Also, have you been exposed to a lot of sunlight over your lifetime? Finally, do you have a family history of skin cancer?
No, I haven’t had anything like this before. I've definitely been in the sun a lot over the years, and I don’t think anyone in my family has had skin cancer.
Thank you. Can you tell me where on your body this lesion is located? Also, what color is it, and does it have a defined border?
It's on my skin. The color is a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. And I'm not sure about the border.

Thank you. Based on what you've told me, it is likely a skin cancer. I recommend getting a biopsy to confirm. I will schedule a biopsy for you. It's important to get it checked out. Are there any questions?
No, I don't have any other questions.

It's bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it's still growing. Plus, the skin around it looks red and puffy, like it's irritated.
